clinical_study.brief_title: Validation of a Novel Simplified Head up Tilt Test (HUTT) Protocol Versus the Conventional Protocol
clinical_study.official_title: Validation of a Novel Simplified Head up Tilt Test (HUTT) Protocol Versus the Conventional Protocol

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to compare the positivity rate associated with a novel simplified Tilt-Table (TT) test protocol versus the conventional TT protocol

detailed_description.textblock: All patients with unexplained syncope at initial evaluation with indication to perform a Head up tilt test (HUTT) will be randomized to "conventional" HUTT protocol or "fast" HUTT protocol characterized by a stabilization phase of 5 min in the supine position; a passive phase of 10 min at a tilt angle of 60 degrees; a provocation phase of further 10 min after 300 micrograms NTG sublingual spray. The novel simplified "fast" HUTT protocol has been designed to provide non inferior positivity rates as compared with the conventional protocol in the selected population.

primary_outcome.measure: HUTT positivity rate during passive phase
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: The study endpoint is the number of patients who experienced syncope during the passive phase of HUTT.

primary_outcome.measure: HUTT positivity rate during active phase
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: The study endpoint is the number of patients who experienced syncope during the active phase of HUTT.

secondary_outcome.measure: The type of HUTT-induced syncope during passive phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: The secondary study endpoint is the number of patients with cardioinhibitory HUTT-syncope during the passive phase of HUTT.

secondary_outcome.measure: The type of HUTT-induced syncope during active phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: The secondary study endpoint is the number of patients with cardioinhibitory HUTT-syncope during the active phase of HUTT.

intervention.description: Fast HUTT protocol stabilization phase of 5 min in the supine position; passive phase of 10 min at a tilt angle of 60 degrees; provocation phase of further 10 min after 300 micrograms NTG sublingual spray.

Conventional HUTT protocol stabilization phase of 5 min in the supine position; passive phase of 20 min at a tilt angle of 60 degrees; provocation phase of further 15 min after 300 micrograms NTG sublingual spray.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients with unexplained syncope at initial evaluation and indication to perform HUTT
Exclusion Criteria:
- No informed consent
- PM/ICD device recipients
